comments: ['AMAZING SCHOOL!!!!!!PERIOD..']

['City Council Speaker Corey Johnson referenced PS/IS 89 as a school with a successful greenhouse where students learn to understand the value of fresh food in growing and eating it. The Brooklyn Eagle writes that Council Speaker Johnson hopes to address healthy food insecurity in more schools with strategies that have already been put in place at PS/IS 89 that make it known for its nutritional programming.', 'My name is Vicki Becker. I am an art teacher/ATR who is very impressed by how well this school is run. I feel safe and the teachers are excellent communicators teaching in Spanish and in English alternating weeks. The students try their best and almost all of them really respect me. I highly recommend this school to anyone!', "I've been going to this school since k-8th grade. I'd say that this school is a better elementary school than middle school.", 'PS/IS 89 student Edward Avelino visited Brooklyn College with Chancellor Carmen Fari√±a and a group of other seventh graders who are part of a city-wide initiative promoting middle school college visits New York 1 News reports.', 'This school has helped me so much. I graduated this year with the ability of speaking Spanish and English fluently, and I know it will help me later in life. I would definitely recommend this school to everyone, the teachers here are very respectful and they make learning fun, the kids sometimes do get very rowdy but the teachers help everything stay in control, and everyone is so helpful. I have never suffered bulling here and I have found my group of best friends. There is a lot of diversity and I will really miss this school. It is very clean, and has a homie feeling to it, with a very panoramic view in the fourth floor. We also have a greenhouse which the younger grades visit and help take care of and also a peer mediation program where the peer mediators help students solve their problems and come to solutions. We also have a medium sized library where my love for books came from, the librarian Ms.Marla is super nice and helpful and she can recommend you any book you want. This school leaves you feeling prepared to enter the "real world" with inalienable experiences, knowledge, and friendships. The only thing I don't like is that this school is a participant in the Wellness in the SchoolsCook for Kids program, which replaces the traditional cafeteria menu with a healthy menu, which is very unappetizing for us but I usually brought my own lunch. Other than that I LOVE PS89!!!!!!!', "This is school is the best there no school like ps.89 full of care love and peace my life is so happy since i've go to ps.89 in 2010", "I love this school too, i wish i didn't have to graduate this year!", 'Chancellor Carmen Fari√±a announced 73 schools selected to join the Learning Partners Program, an innovative and collaborative initiative that brings schools together to share practices to improve learning in the classroom and raise student outcomes. Through the program, one host school with strong practices in a particular focus area will support two partner schools seeking to strengthen their own practices in that area. P.S. 89 Cypress Hills was chosen to host M.S. 390 and Citizens of the World Charter School 1. Read more here.']

That was 11 years ago.']

['I went to this school many many years ago loved it then. ["Child safety is not their concern children are being lined up outside the school with no supervision parents standing around in cluster where as children are unable to get in line because of this. Security guard is either inside the school or standing at the top of the stairs the parent coordinator is never outside you only see her once in a while standing outside with the children. They have a empty school yard where the children can line up by class just like they use to what going to happen come winter, snow and the rain not to mention the cold. They have to stand outside until the parent coordinator come out and tell them to go in. That's another thing she will tell the 4-5th graders to go into the school first while the 2nd graders have to stand outside. You see there is many men shelters in the area as a parent and grand parent you see all types of people hanging around the school so you don't know if these are the parents or pedophiles looking to snatch up and child. Child safety should be the principal and the parent coordinator priority. I'm so happy my grands will be transfer out of this school even though they excel in all area academically safety is more our concern especially when you unable to drop them off and have to wait with them being late even when you get there on time every morning. Still going to report this to the school chancellor, media and my elected official this need to be address. As I drive to work other schools are so organized in the morning lining up and discharging the student. P.S. 159 a change need to be made.", 'PS 159 used theater to teach English to new immigrants, including those who speak Bengali. Through the program, one host school with strong practices in a particular focus area will support two partner schools seeking to strengthen their own practices in that area. PS 321 William Penn was chosen to host P.S. 009 Teunis G. Bergen and P.S. 159. Read more here.']

['Good', 'Nice school, i would advice you to be in a group with friends cause if you make a few wrong turns you could become the laughing stock of the school or you could get jumped by a some of the kids there (like i did last year), but over all its a great school some of the teachers there are funny and if i had to say there two to three strict teachers only.', 'Please reconsider if you are planning to go to this school. The teachers try really hard but some students don\'t give their all and the school doesn\'t provide enough programs.I \'m just saying that they don\'t give you things that you may want or need. For example, they don\'t give you health classes, which I think it may come in handy or just to at least get a base off of the topic. They also don\'t give any classes to learn another language. I honestly think this school does nothing to solve whatever problems they have, for one, instead of giving something like "explorers" give us health classes, or language courses, give the students programs dealing with something career wise... Not everyone may want to have the same career, so this school should be more involved and take more interest as to what the students may like. The school should also reward the children who do very well in all classes, you cannot expect a child to constantly work. Take for example when in interviews for high schools and colleges, the student only has grades to show for themselves. The children who have good grades should also be able to become more creative and more outstanding as an individual. The number of students that roam the halls, are loud and distracting, and cause conflicts with other students should be taught more strictly because as a student that goes to this school, it doesn\'t seem like anything is being done to help any of these students. Please take these notes into consideration.', 'The Department of Education has announced that JHS 218 will have a Spanish dual language program from the start of the 2016-2017 school year.', 'i go to invictus and 218 always bothers us.these students have robbed students in my school and the kids in this school are really bad they always bother us. kids in 218 are in gangs and ive been punched in my face by a kid from there .they took my friend beats head phones.one of the kids in this school has a gun or at least i seen a picture of him posed with one.this kid in my school got slapped for no reason . a female student in there tried to fight my friend.my friend has this expensiv designer belt and some kids tried to rob him my other firend got whipped by some kids with a belt and canes and wait im not done my friend got slammed to the ground when he was in the park and some kids took his hat and threw it in the garbage. if your looking for a school dont take this one into consideration these kids are terrorists when ever i am in fire drills or in the stair case with these kids i feel unsafe even the neighborhood is unsafe i dont know if these kids were from 218 but my teacher told me that when he got out of his car people screamed racial slurs at him like "go back to your kind" and "cracker" and one time i was walking home some kid told me and my group of friends "get off my block" and ran after us', 'I take it your not from east new york huh\n', 'I went there yearssss ago 1987 for 7th&8th grade. Though the neighborhood was veryyyy dangerous and yes there were many troubled kids, the school was excellent. Back then there was an accelerated program where it enabled students take ninth grade classes in 8th grade.The school was limited with its resources but it had very dedicated teachers. Despite many obstacles, some students continued to private HS & specialized HS. Personally, I graduated from Brooklyn Technical HS a year early&completed all the requirements (including the major which back then was mandatory).\nI normally do not post comments anywhere,but I had to speak up for this school. I am thankful for all their efforts. I hope this school continues giving under privileged children a chance to succeed.', 'They are there to teach they are not bouncers. Its not their fault kids act like animals. Blame your peers for cutting into your eduaction not the teacher ijs', 'Ms Lannan retired this year.']

["Also if you're gonna take the SHSAT, this school has the DREAM program in it. It sorta sucks but its better than nothing and it's free.", "Overall, this school offers alot of opportunities( if you're in the honors class). they offer a lot of regents if you're in 711 and 811, algebra 1, earth science, us history, living environments, and geometry. if you wanna go here and actually do well, make sure to get into the honors class or you're pretty much screwed, and dumb. there are fights in the lunchroom, but i dont eat lunch so i hardly even deal with that problem. the problems are that 1.the bathrooms are gross 2.the teachers are super annoying sometimes 3.we have this new cirriculum, wit and wisdom and eureka math.it really sucks. so like if you ignore the classes that have students that fight all the time, you're safe.", 'What time do they start and finish', "Well, I didn't really like this school first, however, there's a new principle this year and he is amazing! The assistant principles are also new (for those of you complaining about Ms.Nelson, she is not in this school anymore, she got replaced by Mrs. Mitchell). This school is a much better place now. If you get into the honors program, they will prepare you for the SHSAT since 6th grade. The guidance counselor is also amazing. He always makes sure that all the students are on track. More students also are graduating this year! Many people passed the SHSAT and got into some of the best schools in NYC (Stuyvesant, Brooklyn Tech) and also top regular schools like Townsend and Midwood (mostly from Class 811). So if you get into the honors program, you have nothing to worry about, this school is the right place for you!!!", "I actually go to this school and I hate it..... I'm an honor student and the principal let us play cards but doesn't let us wear jackets..... We can't even sit at a different table, there is an assistant principal named Ms.Nelson and everytime I try to talk to my cousin she always I mean always tell me to go back to my seat, but there are way more people than me that's at a different table so this school picks on innocent people so please I'm warning the people that want to go to this school..... DON'T", 'A former teacher at IS 242 says he was wrongly charged with harassment and is now suing the city, the Department of Education and a superintendent, reports New York Post.', 'The Soul Tigers Marching Band, a group made up of students from JS 292 and the UFT charter school which share the same building, have regained use of their practice space for their regular six weekly practices following negotiations with school administrators. Read more here.', 'The Soul Tigers Marching Band have rallied after access to their practice space at JS 292 was reduced. The well-known marching band is made up of 60 students from JS 292 and the UFT charter school, which shares the building. Read more here.', 'This post is dated 3 years ago....when did this happen?']

['I went to this school 6 years ago for 4th and 5th grade. While at the school, I have been bullied, accused and stuff. In my opinion, I do not like this school. I currently live in Massachusetts. I love my school there and I have great friends.', "okay so I was not happy with the info on this school I read online. so I went in person visited. I met with staff members and had a tour of the school. this school is a community school. now this may tern some people off. well let me turn you on. this school has many activities , programs, resources excel the children. I met with the principal dean assistant principal and parent cordinator, and counselor. principal doesn't believe in just putting a IEP or IAP (I forgot watt its called) on a child right away she makes sure there is a thorough evaluation of the child first. she questions the Childs teacher as to why he or she feels child needs that label. also special needs children are not thrown in a class with just special needs students. they are in a class with non special needs students and an extra teacher is added into the class. that's great. there's Camba program and another called jets. I love that the principal is ver much involved. I found out this school. use to be a junior high. it is now just an elementary and grades and attendance are improving. I'm really considering transferring my kids out of their charter schools and putting them at ps 306 for 2020. feel free to ask me any questions. I will. be posting updates.", 'can someone post updated info', 'PS 306 is one of four schools that remain on the 2016 "persistently dangerous" list, out of a previous 27 schools. Chalkbeat reports.', 'To my opinion, this school is nothing more but a lazy, bipolar, and disorganized school! Students here have no idea on what they are doing nor on what theyes are attending. My reasons are as follows. As a student recently transfered, I have seen students curse out teachers, students skipping class, and even students talking to their teachers as if though they are their "friends". Not to mention but the Principal and Vice Principal both have different views on how to run the school. For example, the Principal says, "No Phones allowed!" Afterwards the Vice Principal says, "We are going to use out phones for school" The students here have terrible grammar and very bad sense of description. The school allows this kind of nonsense to happen and we are not doing anything about it. If the chancellor is reading this, it would be a special honor for you to visit our school and have your perspective on this school. the bulletin boards have students who miss spell simple words and there sentences don't make any sense. As a result this school is simply very unofficial.', 'Ninety-four low-performing schools are now called ‚ÄúRenewal Schools,‚Äù by DiBlasio. Read more here.']

['van siclen community middle school is a great school and the teachers try there hardest to make sure the students reach the standards.', 'Van Siclen now offers music classes during the school day, and is one of the many schools to benefit from WQXR\'s Instrument Drive. Or do you mean the stats from the NYCDOE which state how staff, students and parents feel about the school and administration- http://schools.nyc.gov/OA/SchoolReports/2015-16/Survey_2016_K654.pdf', 'Thank you "Concerned Parent." However ,just because 31% of the school population has special needs doesn\'t necessarily mean that they need GUIDANCE. ['Hello, I see the reviews bad and good well here‚Äôs both of my pros and cons of how it‚Äôs going so far being in sixth grade there. My pros are that 1- When students need help the teacher helps the student right away, and I noticed that the student got better at it. 2- THE TEACHERS ARE NOT ‚Äúbad‚Äù they are Actully very nice and students respect the teachers for that. 3- As a starter I alredy feel welcome, because they treat us like they knew us when we we‚Äôre born and they have a very good personality 4- We have a big recess yard which makes it very fun to play in and you can do so many things! 5- (not an important pro) They have vending machines and the drinks and snacks are one word AMAZING and cheap üôÇüôÇüôÇ. My cons 1- students were ‚Äúplay‚Äù fighting in the yard and none of the teachers did anything! 2- I noticed students curse out loud and never get in trouble for it I mean I do understand they did it before but that‚Äôs not good! And I will admit I have cursed but not in school! 3- (not important con) THE VENDING MACHINE DOESN‚ÄôT WORK SOMETIMES. 4- They say phones aren‚Äôt allowed out yet when school starts I‚Äôm in the auditorium and I see students playing on there phones I mean I don‚Äôt if that‚Äôs breaking a rule cause class didn‚Äôt start yet. 5- When we get up to get to our class we all always squished by other grades 7th grades and 8th grades and 6th So this are my cons (bad) and pros (good) so both sides are reasonable so my point is the schools not bad, not the best school, but it‚Äôs an Ok school a and all schools have cons and pros.', 'I‚Äôm a student at ditmas jhs 62 I‚Äôm new to the school, I prefer not to mention what class I am in but this school is wonderful but people do have there own opinions, but I would say the school is wonderful because there is nice teachers, nice lunches, and students that are struggling with something or having trouble the teacher will help you. And wow the gym is huge I love it! One thing I don‚Äôt like is during lunch period sometimes the vending machine doesn‚Äôt work but that‚Äôs not the main focus, what I‚Äôm trying to say students are smart and especially if you really concentrate in class you can get a real good grade but I mean I still don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs up coming in the future.', "The school feels like the place where your kid goes to fall through the cracks. The staff are not passionate or focused and they treat the kids more like parts of a horde than individuals. One of my son's sixth grade teachers seemed extremely incompetent and terrible, and when I went down to the school to discuss this with the assistant principal, she said she'd talk to the teacher. By the time I got home my son was already home and he was frantic. It had been just an hour since I had talked to the principal and the teacher had already been spoken to, and she had already confronted my son (in front of his friends!) and argued with him over what had happened. My son gave in and told the teacher that he must have remembered incorrectly, and came home frantic and worried and feeling sorry for the teacher. After this, we let the whole affair go. There was no point speaking to the school if this was how issues were resolved: by confront a kid and making them feel sorry for the teacher and worried for her job. It's been a depressing experience at Ditmas Junior High so far, a lesson in how unhelpful a big, chaotic, uninspired school can be.", 'This was a great school by far my favorite. I was so disappointed to find out that the assistant principal had the nerve to get physical with one of the current students. AP Lynch had no right to do so, being that the student was not disrupting the class and getting physical is never the answer. Her behavior was uncalled for and very unprofessional. She has shown that her temper and impulsiveness at the school has tarnished the safety of the students.', 'Students from Ditmas Junior High School attended a ‚ÄúScience Day‚Äù at JFK airport to see the Solar Impulse Airplane at its final U.S. stop in the first solar-powered flight around the world. Read more here.', 'Children from the Ditmas Junior High School class went to the White House for a coding workshop on December 8th. Read more here.', 'This school has a compassionate staff, and they mean well, however, the academics is way below standard. If your child is average or even above average, they will fall behind because of the extremely slow pace. A lot of the students are struggling and the lessons that are taught accommodate only those students. That makes it really bad for average and above average students, they fall way behind as a result of the majority.']

['MaryBeth Meenan, 2nd grade special education teacher at P.S. 102 Bayview, is one of the 17 recipients of the 2016 Big Apple Award. The Big Apple Award is a citywide recognition program that celebrates the incredible work of New York City public school teachers. Read more here.', 'PS 102 is profiled in an Advocates for Children report "A is for All: Meeting the Literacy Needs of Students with and without Disabilities in the New York City Public Schools".', "2 months into kindergarten at PS 102, and very unhappy. Some of my complaints are probably general DOE complaints, but the communication with the parents is terrible, everyone (teachers, administration, etc) give conflicting information regarding student progress and needs, and actually caught a teacher in a lie regarding child's activities. It is impossible to try and work with this school to make any improvements, with everyone just blaming someone else (I spent 2 weeks going back and forth between the district and the school, with both claiming the other was at fault for a delay). This school makes me want to pull my child out and homeschool, that is how horrible the last two months of my life have been.", 'We are very happy with PS 102. It is a very large school but well kept. The garden and playground are beautiful. I wish the kids got to use them everyday or more often but kindergarten does go out in the spring. Its difficult to get into the G&T program here as they only have room for the kids with the highest scores, but we find the regular classroom challenging. The class sizes need to be much smaller (my son currently has 30) and the Common Core has its own set of problems. However, the kids get gym, music, science, social studies and field trips. My son does more than I did as a first grader years ago in the suburbs. Not perfect but really very good.']

["so I'm going to be honest here. While this school does provide education that is leagues ahead of other schools in it's region, the area the have a VERY ACUTE lack of expertise are child counseling/social services and the commitment to do so. They instead much rather rely on a policy of punishment shaming to set the kids in line, which only works for the short term. In the long run, this can lead to the afflicted child to develop a self-depreciating and pessimistic attitude and fear of going to school in general. Another thing that often goes under the radar is that the Teachers here are HIGHLY biased against children they perceive as troublemakers whether that is true or not. I was a former student here and I came on the receiving end of that policy. To this day in high school I am still dealing with the after-effects of my time here in this school and the lack of proper counseling measures really make me question do they actually even care about children (ages 5-10 NO LESS) who are prone to being mentally disturbed (bullying, exclusion, depression ETC). ["My child is in 6th grade at PS/IS 163. This school is a huge disappointment. My child is learning nothing in Science and Social Studies in 6th grade. The reason why I say this is because the teachers are not teaching. Every class the Social Studies teacher has the students read the textbook by themselves and then answer the questions with their partners while she's busy on her computer. If they can't finish the work they bring home to finish it. Every test is either in class open book test or take home. As for the science teacher,very often he goes to the bathroom twice during one period. My child never needs to study for the tests. The tests are just copying the material from the book and move it over to the test paper. Same thing with the science teacher. Lately (soon after the Statewide Exams are over), the ELA teacher had the students read the booklet and answer the questions with their partners while she's on her computer as usual. Oh, I forgot to mention the ELA teacher teaches ELA and Social Studies while the Math teacher teaches Math and science. There are only two classes in 6th grade not including the special ed and these two teachers teaches both classes. SO, you child is doomed. If you are those parents who don't care much about your child's education. Then this school is ok for you.", 'Is this school good\n']

["As a parent at PS 164 for the past 3 years, I can confirm the environment is very special.  It is so supportive and caring.  The children feel this and know the teachers and administrators care for them too.  The well balanced diversity (the school has 4-5 official languages including Bengali and Arabic) which means that every child feels included and special.  Differences are celebrated and welcome.  Ms. Steinberg is masterful at recruiting only the best teachers and keeping some traditional, yet welcome things like school uniforms and good attendance certificates.  Importantly, the school is small enough (compared to other elementary schools) so that needs of parents are addressed without too much formality. The school has amazing extracurricular programs/features that many schools do not have the funding to have such as a beautiful library with school librarian, a state of the art computer lab with Apple computers, both science AND STEAM classes, music, gym, art and others.  The PTA can use more parent involvement but has come a long way considering that the PTA was only formed a couple years ago.  Many of the families have 2 working parents so engaging them can present challenges and the strong work ethic directly shows in the classroom and school.  You know it's a good school when your child doesn't want to miss a day of school, even with a 90 minute a day commute.", 'Just want to say that Ms Steinberg is an amazing principal. The caring n nuturing environment. that she has created along with her wonderful teachers ,n staff have given my child a new outlook on school .For the first time my child is happy going to school. Iam so greatful for the hardwork n caring my child is recieving from ps164 üòÅ', 'ps164 was a great school we care for everyone, when Principal Margaret Choy-Shan left we got a surprise for her we named the playground after her named a bench after her and mariachi to play songs for her. Overall we care about everyone there.']

['is the school offering halal food in Cafeteria for kids ?', 'This school is Perfect It has free computers,lockers,food. i am a 7th grader btw', "I agree, the regents class placement does seem very biased. My child was told all year long that it doesn't matter if you have a hundred average or an 80 average if she did not want you in her regents class you were out.", "As a student who attends this school, I believe that this school is biased and there is a great deal of favoritism, especially with selection of the Regents class. The Regents class is supposedly open to 'the 30 highest average 7th graders' but was chosen (in 2014/2015, at least) by who was the teacher's favorite. For example, students with 96s weren't getting in while 89s were, including students with lower conduct than others and lower state assessment scores. The Regents teacher also lied about the selection, guaranteeing placement to whomever she 'liked' and then, when the placement was done, she defended with 'I had nothing to do with the placement'. As well as favoritism in that, teachers only select certain students (usually their class favorite) to be part of school events (the ribbon cutting ceremony, enrichment, monitoring) and give extra credit for no reason. The teachers at this school, as well, lack patience and often do not grade assignments but rather grade solely on, once more, favoritism. Also, whenever a student protests something formally (not rudely or by confrontation) they are immediately lectured and reprimanded. When a parent or guardian contacts an assistant principal, they literally respond with, 'please do not bring this up again. What's done is done'.", 'Does this school give free lunch', 'Does this school have lockers', 'SEALL student wins national award for handwriting.
